verses.verse: Boast not thyself <S%H408><s%> <S%H1984><s%> of tomorrow; <S%H3117><s%> <S%H4279><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> a day <S%H3117><s%> may bring forth. <S%H3205><s%>
Let another man <S%H2114><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> thee, and not <S%H3808><s%> thine own mouth; <S%H6310><s%> a stranger, <S%H5237><s%> and not <S%H408><s%> thine own lips. <S%H8193><s%>

A stone <S%H68><s%> is heavy, <S%H3514><s%> and the sand <S%H2344><s%> weighty; <S%H5192><s%> but a fool's <S%H191><s%> wrath <S%H3708><s%> is heavier <S%H3515><s%> than them both. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8147><s%>
Wrath <S%H2534><s%> is cruel, <S%H395><s%> and anger <S%H639><s%> is outrageous; <S%H7858><s%> but who <S%H4310><s%> is able to stand <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> envy? <S%H7068><s%>
Open <S%H1540><s%> rebuke <S%H8433><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than secret <S%H5641><s%> love. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H160><s%>
Faithful <S%H539><s%> are the wounds <S%H6482><s%> of a friend; <S%H157><s%> but the kisses <S%H5390><s%> of an enemy <S%H8130><s%> are deceitful. <S%H6280><s%>

The full <S%H7649><s%> soul <S%H5315><s%> loatheth <S%H947><s%> a honeycomb; <S%H5317><s%> but to the hungry <S%H7457><s%> soul <S%H5315><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> bitter thing <S%H4751><s%> is sweet. <S%H4966><s%>

As a bird <S%H6833><s%> that wandereth <S%H5074><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> her nest, <S%H7064><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> is a man <S%H376><s%> that wandereth <S%H5074><s%> from his place. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4725><s%>

Ointment <S%H8081><s%> and perfume <S%H7004><s%> rejoice <S%H8055><s%> the heart: <S%H3820><s%> so doth the sweetness <S%H4986><s%> of a man's friend <S%H7453><s%> by hearty counsel. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6098><s%> <S%H5315><s%>

Thine own friend, <S%H7453><s%> and thy father's <S%H1><s%> friend, <S%H7453><s%> forsake <S%H5800><s%> not; <S%H408><s%> neither <S%H408><s%> go <S%H935><s%> into thy brother's <S%H251><s%> house <S%H1004><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of thy calamity: <S%H343><s%> for better <S%H2896><s%> is a neighbor <S%H7934><s%> that is near <S%H7138><s%> than a brother <S%H4480><s%> <S%H251><s%> far off. <S%H7350><s%>
My son, <S%H1121><s%> be wise, <S%H2449><s%> and make my heart <S%H3820><s%> glad, <S%H8055><s%> that I may answer <S%H7725><s%> <S%H1697><s%> him that reproacheth <S%H2778><s%> me.
A prudent <S%H6175><s%> man foreseeth <S%H7200><s%> the evil, <S%H7451><s%> and hideth himself; <S%H5641><s%> but the simple <S%H6612><s%> pass on, <S%H5674><s%> and are punished. <S%H6064><s%>

Take <S%H3947><s%> his garment <S%H899><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> is surety <S%H6148><s%> for a stranger, <S%H2114><s%> and take a pledge <S%H2254><s%> of him for <S%H1157><s%> a strange woman. <S%H5237><s%>

He that blesseth <S%H1288><s%> his friend <S%H7453><s%> with a loud <S%H1419><s%> voice, <S%H6963><s%> rising early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> it shall be counted <S%H2803><s%> a curse <S%H7045><s%> to him.
A continual <S%H2956><s%> dropping <S%H1812><s%> in a very rainy <S%H5464><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> and a contentious <S%H4079><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> are alike. <S%H7737><s%>
Whosoever hideth <S%H6845><s%> her hideth <S%H6845><s%> the wind, <S%H7307><s%> and the ointment <S%H8081><s%> of his right hand, <S%H3225><s%> which betrayeth <S%H7121><s%> itself.
Iron <S%H1270><s%> sharpeneth <S%H2300><s%> iron; <S%H1270><s%> so a man <S%H376><s%> sharpeneth <S%H2300><s%> the countenance <S%H6440><s%> of his friend. <S%H7453><s%>

Whoso keepeth <S%H5341><s%> the fig tree <S%H8384><s%> shall eat <S%H398><s%> the fruit <S%H6529><s%> thereof: so he that waiteth <S%H8104><s%> on his master <S%H113><s%> shall be honored. <S%H3513><s%>
As in water <S%H4325><s%> face <S%H6440><s%> answereth to face, <S%H6440><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> the heart <S%H3820><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> to man. <S%H120><s%>
Hell <S%H7585><s%> and destruction <S%H10><s%> are never <S%H3808><s%> full; <S%H7646><s%> so the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> are never <S%H3808><s%> satisfied. <S%H7646><s%>
As the refining pot <S%H4715><s%> for silver, <S%H3701><s%> and the furnace <S%H3564><s%> for gold; <S%H2091><s%> so is a man <S%H376><s%> to <S%H6310><s%> his praise. <S%H4110><s%>

Though <S%H518><s%> thou shouldest bray <S%H3806><s%> <S%H853><s%> a fool <S%H191><s%> in a mortar <S%H4388><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> wheat <S%H7383><s%> with a pestle, <S%H5940><s%> yet will not <S%H3808><s%> his foolishness <S%H200><s%> depart <S%H5493><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%> him.
Be thou diligent to know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H3045><s%> the state <S%H6440><s%> of thy flocks, <S%H6629><s%> and look <S%H7896><s%> <S%H3820><s%> well to thy herds. <S%H5739><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> riches <S%H2633><s%> are not <S%H3808><s%> forever: <S%H5769><s%> and doth <S%H518><s%> the crown <S%H5145><s%> endure to every generation? <S%H1755><s%> <S%H1755><s%>
The hay <S%H2682><s%> appeareth, <S%H1540><s%> and the tender grass <S%H1877><s%> showeth itself, <S%H7200><s%> and herbs <S%H6212><s%> of the mountains <S%H2022><s%> are gathered. <S%H622><s%>
The lambs <S%H3532><s%> are for thy clothing, <S%H3830><s%> and the goats <S%H6260><s%> are the price <S%H4242><s%> of the field. <S%H7704><s%>

And thou shalt have goats' <S%H5795><s%> milk <S%H2461><s%> enough <S%H1767><s%> for thy food, <S%H3899><s%> for the food <S%H3899><s%> of thy household, <S%H1004><s%> and for the maintenance <S%H2416><s%> for thy maidens. <S%H5291><s%>
